docs.abstract: Chevron, the No. 2 energy producer in the United States, gains assets in shale oil drilling and liquefied natural gas by acquiring Anadarko, based in Texas.
docs.snippet: Chevron, the No. 2 energy producer in the United States, gains assets in shale oil drilling and liquefied natural gas by acquiring Anadarko, based in Texas.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Chevron positioned itself to become the dominant oil producer in the field that is driving the American shale revolution when it said on Friday that it was buying Anadarko Petroleum for $33 billion.

headline.main: Chevron to Acquire Anadarko Petroleum for $33 Billion, a Shift in the Battle for Shale
headline.print_headline: Chevron Says It Will Acquire Anadarko Petroleum for $33 Billion

docs.abstract: Occidental’s proposal remained at $76 a share. But that announcement and an earlier one that it would sell off some Anadarko investments were meant to counter Chevron’s bid.
docs.snippet: Occidental’s proposal remained at $76 a share. But that announcement and an earlier one that it would sell off some Anadarko investments were meant to counter Chevron’s bid.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Occidental Petroleum fortified its bid for Anadarko Petroleum on Sunday night with more cash in its latest effort to outbid Chevron and win the support of Anadarko’s shareholders who may well make the final decision on a merger.

headline.main: Occidental Ups Its Cash Offer for Anadarko
headline.print_headline: Occidental Ups Cash Bid To Acquire Anadarko

docs.abstract: Occidental and Chevron are competing to acquire Anadarko and its holdings in the Permian Basin. Chevron will now have four days to improve its bid.
docs.snippet: Occidental and Chevron are competing to acquire Anadarko and its holdings in the Permian Basin. Chevron will now have four days to improve its bid.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — In an escalating bidding war, Anadarko Petroleum said on Monday that it intended to reject its first suitor in a takeover bid, Chevron, after Occidental Petroleum came forward with a better offer.

headline.main: Anadarko Says It Now Favors Occidental Bid Over Chevron
headline.print_headline: Anadarko Shifts Its Favor  As Occidental Sweetens Bid

docs.abstract: Occidental Petroleum announced a $38 billion bid for Anadarko Petroleum, challenging Chevron for control of the independent oil and gas company.
docs.snippet: Occidental Petroleum announced a $38 billion bid for Anadarko Petroleum, challenging Chevron for control of the independent oil and gas company.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Occidental Petroleum unveiled an audacious $38 billion takeover bid for Anadarko Petroleum on Wednesday, challenging Chevron — a company four times its size — in a battle for dominance of the biggest and most productive oil field in the United States.

headline.main: Occidental Bids $38 Billion for Anadarko, Challenging Chevron
headline.print_headline: Occidental’s Bid for Anadarko Rattles Oil Business

byline.original: By Clifford Krauss and Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: The company’s bid for Anadarko prevailed despite Chevron’s greater resources and will give it the biggest presence in the rich Permian Basin fields.
docs.snippet: The company’s bid for Anadarko prevailed despite Chevron’s greater resources and will give it the biggest presence in the rich Permian Basin fields.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Occidental Petroleum pulled it off.

headline.main: Occidental Petroleum Emerges With the Prize in a Takeover Fight
headline.print_headline: In Takeover Duel, Chevron Yields Spoils to Occidental

docs.abstract: Berkshire Hathaway said it will buy preferred stock in Occidental Petroleum to help it upstage Chevron’s proposed acquisition of Anadarko.
docs.snippet: Berkshire Hathaway said it will buy preferred stock in Occidental Petroleum to help it upstage Chevron’s proposed acquisition of Anadarko.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Warren E. Buffett hasn’t shown much interest in oil stocks in recent years, but that changed on Tuesday when his company, Berkshire Hathaway, committed $10 billion to help Occidental Petroleum compete in a bidding war for Anadarko Petroleum.

headline.main: Warren Buffett Backs Occidental’s Bid for Anadarko With $10 Billion Investment
headline.print_headline: Buffett Picks a Side in an Oil Bidding War
